page.title: 15LOCAL BIRD POPULATION
page.content: We tried to find out the most common and the least common type of birds in the grid area. In{Longwood}at the time of the survey (midsummer 1985),the most common bird was the{House Martin. House Martins spend the summer in the area then migrate to warmer climates during our winter. We found that the least common birds were: robins, starlings, carrion crows, black-headed gulls and black birds. Altogether,we found 9 species of birds common to this area. We also found a reason for birds in our area being so few: the food available to them is sufficient but not abundant and is sparse compared to the average bird habitat. Also the ground is high and dry and water is scarce. The shelter available was limited to rocks, shrubs and crannies as there are few trees in the area.
